utterances.utterance: He was never a moderate. He was there as a Trojan horse. And now the horse has come up lame.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Geraldo, you know, this is true because if you look at the headlines it says moderates in the Senate holding up Biden's agenda.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Which proves that Joe Biden is actually the radical left.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: That's right.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. He's with Bernie on this, Geraldo.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Well, you got Kyrsten Sinema and Joe Manchin. That's the moderates in the Senate.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Well, no Joe Biden.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's -- you got two people.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But not Joe Biden. Democrats for good reason sweating the governor's race in Virginia. It's a big one and it could tell us a lot about the balance of power in Washington, D.C. next year, coming up.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Story of my life. Democrats growing more anxious by the day over the tight governor's race in Virginia, which is shaping up to be a major referendum on the left's education policies. Republican Glenn Youngkin, huh? Says schools will be the deciding factor for voters and his opponent, Terry McAuliffe, is trying to play cleanup over past comments about how he'd handle the state's education system.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Who do you think should be in control of education if not Virginia parents?

utterances.speaker: TERRY MCAULIFFE, DEMIOCRATIC GUBERNATORIAL CANDIDATE IN VIRGINAI
utterances.utterance: Have you been vaccinated yet. That's the question I want to know? You should have a mask on.

utterances.speaker: UNKNOWN
utterances.utterance: Who do you think should be in control of education if not Virginia parents?

utterances.speaker: MCAULIFFE
utterances.utterance: Get a mask on and get vaccinated. You're dangerous here. I'll build education. That's why Fox News has me leading. Glenn Youngkin will destroy Virginia's education system.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: He's a winner. The race is also shaping up to be a major bellwether on the Democrats prospects in the 2022 midterms. Katie you actually live in this state.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I do.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. So, from that statement I would like to pose a question.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Okay.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What are your thoughts?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Do you like my take, Greg --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, I would like -- I would like a hot take.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: -- on this -- on this race that you don't care about at all.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Does it even make your bellwether?

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It may be a bellwether. We'll have to see. Virginia has been a blue state for a long time. It shifted. Northern Virginia has completely dominated the state just like a lot of other previously red states. The metropolises and the rural areas are very different in terms of how they vote. But this race is interesting because of the issue of education. And when Terry McAuliffe talks about wanting to build up education in Virginia, he's talking about dumping more taxpayer money, raising taxes, and giving more money to the unions.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Republicans like Glenn Youngkin when they talk about education, talk about school choice, allowing parents to use more of their own money to send their kids to maybe a different school. Giving parents the ability to know what's in their library. And if there's pornographic books in the library for people who are under the age of 18, especially young children, Glenn Youngkin believes that you should be able to go in and say I don't want this book in my kid's library. Terry McAuliffe made a big mistake during the last debate by saying no, parents don't have the right to go into their schools or have really any control over their kids' education. And the pandemic of course as we've talked about a number of times has really shined a light on what kids are learning, where people's money is going, and whether people really want to keep their kids trapped in these school. So, it's going to be a tough call but some people are saying -- some people are saying Virginia actually may sweep red all together not just with the governor's race.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, right now, Dana, the race is tighter than Brian Kilmeade's botoxed forehead.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't think he has a botoxed forehead.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Well, it's --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But it is tighter than a tick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, there you go. I like that, tighter --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I wrote that right there, tighter than a tick.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Tighter than a tick.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You needed to write that down?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I don't know. I was just thinking of a good line.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What's your -- what's your prediction?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Okay. So, I don't know. It is that close and yes, Fox News has McAuliffe up by three in the poll, but that is, basically, that means it's tied.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. Plus or minus.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Oh, it's a Fox poll.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. And so --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It must be true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think a couple of things. The Democrats are trying to throw the kitchen sink --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- right. They want to bring up Trump, January 6, abortion, all these other issues. I do think that intensity especially when it comes to parents matters. Also, the Democrats on the far left, they're not excited. McAuliffe himself said that one of the problems is that Biden is not popular there. And black women who are really very good at getting out the vote, they're not enthusiastic either. So, Democrats have a lot of problems. However, I was told today by two different people who called me separately saying they are concerned because they've realized now that Democrats are waking up to the fact that they could really lose in Virginia. And that's why Obama and everybody is going to try to head to -- let's just say South Carolina to Virginia in order to try to pull out a win.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Joe said no. What are your thoughts, Geraldo?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Thank you for that probing comment. I think McAuliffe is a street fighter. Don't ever sell him short. I think that if he does lose, it'll be because of critical race theory and all of the Virginia parents getting, you know, tussles with cops over what's being taught in the classroom and then exaggerated. But I think again, it seems to me, Katie knows much better than I do, it seems to me that Youngkin is -- he's like a kind of a squishy guy.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: What do you mean he's a squishy guy? He's not a -- he's not a --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He's not a politician.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You need -- you need --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He's an outsider.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Compared to McAuliffe who's like a swagger and charismatic, big guy --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I though you said he's a street fighter?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He's -- yes, he's like a munchkin.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He's he seems like a good business guy who has the interest of --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: A munchkin.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And what do you tell -- I'm sure he's a wonderful, hard -- good- hearted person, but McAuliffe could like eat him for lunch it seems.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He probably would --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: He lost in the debates.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Wow.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What do you think, Jesse?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Well, I think Dana actually predicted a McAuliffe loss so that's how I was going to --

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I did. I said --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A McAuliffe loss?

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Yes. I said that Youngkin will win by a hair.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes. I like that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I take the other one.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I also um don't live in Virginia, so the only thing the other people -- the rest of the country see this as this is a woke thermometer.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I agree. That's what it is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: This is how woke can the Democrats get without catching a fever getting sick and die.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Nicely done.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: If they -- if he loses, then Terry McAuliffe went way woke, and now all the rest of the national Democrats are going to say we need to pump the brakes on the CRT stuff. We need to recalibrate what we're saying about schools because this thing is deadly and that's what i think the national implication is.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're smoking too much woke.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Exactly. All right, coming up, NBA superstar Kyrie --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Kyrie.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Irving speaking out after getting --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You don't know Kyrie Irving?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I don't watch sports. After getting sidelined over his vaccine stance.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not just basketball.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Airline pilots to NBA Superstar's vaccine mandates are forcing Americans out of their jobs. The Brooklyn Nets banning star player Kyrie Irving from all team activities including playing any home games in New York City until he's vaccinated. Kyrie couldn't wind -- could wind up losing millions over the season depending on how many games he's forced to sit down on the sidelines, but he is not backing down. Kyrie says he's standing his ground against his own team.

utterances.speaker: KYRIE IRVING, NBA PLAYER
utterances.utterance: What would you do, you know, if you felt uncomfortable going into the season when you are promised that you have exemptions or that you don't have to be forced to get the vaccine? I'm staying ground on what I believe in. It's just as simple as that. It's not about being anti-vax or about being, you know, on one side of the other. It is just being about being true to what feels good for me. I chose to be unvaccinated and that was my choice. And I would ask you all just to respect that choice.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, Greg, it's not -- he's not just making the argument that this is a personal health choice, he's also making the argument that the goalposts were moved on him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, the season started and then they changed the rules much like Biden said there wouldn't be this federal mandate and now there is one.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes. He made his decision with the best intentions. He did not see this coming. He ran into a fearful NBA. Every step now is dictated by lawyers who are operating with the ominous threat of liability for everything. Add to that how the media has turned this into a left-right thing and he becomes suddenly like a sacrificial lamb. You got to go back to how disconnected our actions are from risk it. Doesn't matter that an unvaxxed child has the same risk as a vaxxed middle- aged person. That's a fact. That was from the New York Times. It doesn't matter that a healthy lean athlete has a different risk than an elderly obese person. We know the risk factors. The key risk factors are age, the older you are, and weight, if you're obese. But we can't even broach these topics, so instead, we have these blanket -- like mandates that are just completely wrong. And I mean, if you would --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What about Kyrie Irving?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Wait, wait, wait.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: What about Kyrie Irving?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you want me to call him stupid?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I mean, you're talking about everything --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Do you want me to call him stupid?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- except the defiance --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I mean, do you want me to call him stupid?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I want to -- I want to call --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Because you want to.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I will say this.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You want to.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I will say this. When people make a stand like this and it's costing him and his family and his children $400,000 a game, there's something else going on besides his --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, it's called bravery.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: -- his repugnance over the vaccine.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe money isn't the issue.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Bravery, that's bravery? It's bravery?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Maybe money isn't the issue.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's against the law in San Francisco to be unvaxxed. It's against the law of New York City to be unvaxxed, so he's going to be on -- he'd be the only one in the stadium.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It's not against the law. It's not against the law.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It is. It's against the law.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, he should be arrested? So, you want him arrested?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: It's illegal. There's a law.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: It is not against the law. That is not accurate. There are mandates where you can and cannot go, but it is not illegal to be unvaccinated. And also being unvaccinated --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I went -- I went to Del Frisco's, the steak place last night.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Oh, the high-class problem.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: There were two gigantic bodyguards at the door, both had big masks on. And they said, OK, Geraldo, let me see your vaccine passport. So, I'm walking, I'm lame. I should get my wallet out. Craig is helping me. I finally got to show that I'm vaccinated, and then my test to get into the steak joint across the street that I've been going through for 50 years.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: So, what -- so you feel because you're being punished, so should he?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think that rules are rules, you know. I don't like going 65 either.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: I never saw you as rule-caller.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I don't like going 65 either. You know, I like -- I'd rather go 85, I'd rather go 105, you know, but the law -- I think that this guy is wrecking his life right now for no real reason and it's absolute stubbornness based on nothing.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It's principle.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: So, Jesse, there are a lot of people who have a lot more to lose, who don't have millions of dollars who have stood their ground and quit their jobs or have been fired by these companies giving in to all these mandates who are standing up for this. And I think when they put -- these politicians put these mandates in, they really underestimate -- and it's underestimating what people are willing to do to stand up for what they believe in especially when it comes to their personal health.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: De Blasio put the mandate on New York City, that's why this is happening. So, let's remember why. I understand the Nets GM doing this though. If you have a guy who can only play in road games, he has to sit at the bench --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Certain road games.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: He's going to sit the bench every single home game in Brooklyn while the rest of his teammates play, and the whole crowd at the Barclays Center yells at Kyrie Irving, and then he goes back on the road and then plays road games. This is a team a sport. This isn't tennis. This isn't golf where you're out for yourself and you can pick your tournament. You need chemistry. You need -- you need the offense to flow well if you're going to make a run at a championship. And Kyrie, he recruited Durant. He recruited Harden to come to Brooklyn to make a run at a title. And all of a sudden, now he's going to say, you know what, I'm not anti-vax or I'm not pro-vax so I'm just going to sit out half the season while you guys moved everything in your lives to come here and win a championship.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Knowing his other --

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: That was before the mandate though.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: But there was other things going on in his life last season.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: I get that. I get that. Well, you know what, he should have just said -- this is what I would do. I wouldn't be a little cute about it. I would have said religious exemption, medical exemption. But instead, he just comes out and says, I don't know how I feel about it. It's just not a strong enough stance to make people understand it.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: He didn't say he doesn't know how he feels about it. He said the choice for me is this.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, but it's about him, not about the team that he signed the contract with.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: But you know the worst thing about this is --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: People are getting vaccinated because --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: The worst thing about this is we now have created an artificial division. A couple of years ago, it was race versus race. Thank you, CNN. It was gender issues. But now, Geraldo, you're mad at this guy.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I am mad at him.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're mad at him --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Because he's not just hurt -- he's not just hurting himself.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, but what I'm saying is you're being played. You're being played

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: He's hurting everybody like Jesse who invested in Brooklyn Nets.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: You're being played. You are being played.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You're being stubborn.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: No, I'm trying to explain.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: You're being blunt-headed.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Can I finish my point? You are being manipulated to disagree with somebody. This is an artificial division and we shouldn't play into this.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: I want Dana to dig in.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: This is what the mandate did.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Dana.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Well, I don't know why they couldn't do daily testing, right? So --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Yes, that's true.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: You can do that in a lot of places. If you're not vaccinated, if that's the rule at your place of work, you can get daily tested. And the tests, you know, however much they cost, it's probably going to cost -- it would cost them less to do daily testing than I think to lose the guy for a season. But here's also --

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: A star.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I wrote all this stuff down about risk-benefit analysis and consequence so I'm not going to talk about that because you already did. But this is a guy -- you know, he speaks his mind, and you might not agree with him. In 2020, he was all for calling off the whole season so that people could go out and speak about racial injustice. So, he stands for what he believes in, and you have to respect him for that.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Or he's got something else going on besides basketball.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: You don't know that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: Somebody told me he's about to get traded anyway.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: All right, up next, an explosive admission of liberal media bias from Katie Couric. What she caught up from an interview with the late Justice Bader Ginsburg.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Katie Couric making a bombshell admission on liberal media bias. In her new memoir, the former anchor reveals that she cut out part of her 2016 interview with Ruth Bader Ginsburg in order to "protect the late Supreme Court Justice." Kirk editing out RBG's scorn for taking a knee during the Kaepernick National Anthem controversy in which the Justice reportedly said those who kneeled during the anthem were showing "contempt for a government that has made it possible for their parents and grandparents to live a decent life." I don't know, Greg. What do you think?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: What do I think?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It's slick, isn't it?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: It is slick, real slick.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Five years later.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That dame is slick, I tell you. What are we in, like a 1950s, you know, detective pulp novel? This is -- how much more proof do you need that the left always has their thumb on every scale. This is especially amazing because she dismissed a Supreme Court Justice cogent opinion as the product of some kind of cognitive decline as if this malicious elf has the I.Q. to do that. Like, oh, this is such a bad eye -- this is a bad take. I better shield her because it's not her take.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Was it to shield her though or was it to protect the cause of the kneeling? What do you think --

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: Both.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: It was both.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think they were protecting her. Yes, I think --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Protecting her?

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Protecting her profession.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: I think that she must -- but this is -- this assumes -- who are -- who's Katie Couric to assume that Ruth Bader Ginsburg needed protecting?

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: That's the point.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: She said it on purpose. Remember they tried to get her retire because they were like, oh, she should retire, and she was like, no. Like, she knew exactly what she was doing and she was cogent to the end. If you were Yahoo! News, wouldn't you be mad. That's all about the clicks. And then --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Yes, that would have been a big article.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: -- she passed on giving that. And let me tell you. If somebody here did an interview with Justice Thomas and he said something that was very provocative and in 10 years from now wrote a book and said, actually, he said, you wouldn't believe what he said, but I protected him. I mean, that would be outrageous just as this is.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Right. And that's journalism, the most controversial thing, the interviewer or he says, you put it on blast.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Not that you asked but I totally agree with Justice Ginsburg's take on Kaepernick and the kneeling.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Not that I ask.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Not that you ask.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: You don't need to say it though.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: And everyone edits left, edits right, edits the times, edits the journal, edits the --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: That was a significant edit.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: People --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Some would say deceptive and devious.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I would say -- I would say unless Katie Couric admitted that she did it to save Ruth Bader Ginsburg -- I haven't read the book.

utterances.speaker: GUTFELD
utterances.utterance: She did that.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
utterances.utterance: But that's what she said in the book.

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: She did. It was in the intro.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: I think it was an unnecessary -- I heard it but I didn't know if you were saying it or she was --

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: OK.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Because it was unclear.

utterances.speaker: PAVLICH
utterances.utterance: Are you OK?

utterances.speaker: WATTERS
utterances.utterance: Don't defend this, Geraldo. Don't defend this. You of all people.

utterances.speaker: RIVERA
utterances.utterance: Ruth Bader Ginsburg in my house is like -- Jewish people don't believe in idolatry, but if there was idolatry, there would be a statue of Ruth Bader Ginsburg.

utterances.speaker: PERINO
